text: Soul blues is a style of blues music developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s that combines elements of soul music and urban contemporary music. ==Origin== Afroamerican singers and musicians who grew up listening to the electric blues by artists such as Muddy Waterscite web |url=https://www.pbs.org/wnet/americanmasters/episodes/muddy-waters/cant-be- satisfied/730/ |title=Muddy Waters: Can't Be Satisfied |last=Gordon |first=Robert |publisher=PBS | accessdate=January 6 2015, Jimmy Reed, and Elmore James, and soul singers such as Sam Cooke, Ray Charles and Otis Reddingcite web|url=http://otisredding.com/bio/bio/|archive- url=https://archive.today/20101126083955/http://otisredding.com/bio/bio/|url- status=dead|archive-date=November 26 2010|title=Biography| accessdate=August 3 2011 |publisher=Otis Redding Official Website fused blues and soul music. Bobby Bland was one of the pioneers of this style. ==See also== * List of soul-blues musicians * Soul music * Blues * R&B; * Gospel music * Doo wop * Funk ==References== Category:Soul music genres Category:Blues music genres
title: Soul blues
